{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Example: The latest XKCD in Python"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "In this notebook we **fetch and display the latest XKCD strip** using both regular Python and special IPython features.\n",
    "\n",
    "Also this notebook is associated with IPython kernel, and may therefore contain Python code. "
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Assigning variables"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We have been given [the XKCD API](https://xkcd.com/json.html) `https://xkcd.com/info.0.json` for fetching information of the latest strip in JSON.\n",
    "\n",
    "Let's save that URL into a variable."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "url = 'https://xkcd.com/info.0.json'"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "## Importing libraries"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Then we continue with importing [Requests library](http://docs.python-requests.org/en/latest/) for easily fetching information from the Internet."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import requests"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now we are ready to fetch the data at the URL into a variable."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "response = requests.get(url)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Evaluating variables"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "And we evaluate response and its content into standard output to see what we have."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "<Response [200]>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 5,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "response"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "b'{\"month\": \"1\", \"num\": 2250, \"link\": \"\", \"year\": \"2020\", \"news\": \"\", \"safe_title\": \"OK/okay/ok\", \"transcript\": \"\", \"alt\": \"After changing it back and forth several times and consulting with internet linguist Gretchen McCulloch, I settled on \\\\\"ok\\\\\" in my book How To, but I\\'m still on the fence. Maybe I should just switch to \\\\\"oK.\\\\\"\", \"img\": \"https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/ok_okay_ok.png\", \"title\": \"OK/okay/ok\", \"day\": \"3\"}'"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 6,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "response.content"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "That is somewhat readable, but we should do better."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Displaying JSON"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "One of the many great Jupyter features provided by the underlying IPython foundation, is support for rich output.\n",
    "\n",
    "In this case, we can use [IPython display JSON helper class](https://ipython.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/generated/IPython.display.html#IPython.display.JSON) to let JupyterLab know that it should display JSON."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "application/json": {
       "alt": "After changing it back and forth several times and consulting with internet linguist Gretchen McCulloch, I settled on \"ok\" in my book How To, but I'm still on the fence. Maybe I should just switch to \"oK.\"",
       "day": "3",
       "img": "https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/ok_okay_ok.png",
       "link": "",
       "month": "1",
       "news": "",
       "num": 2250,
       "safe_title": "OK/okay/ok",
       "title": "OK/okay/ok",
       "transcript": "",
       "year": "2020"
      },
      "text/plain": [
       "<IPython.core.display.JSON object>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 7,
     "metadata": {
      "application/json": {
       "expanded": false,
       "root": "root"
      }
     },
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from IPython.display import JSON\n",
    "\n",
    "json = response.json()\n",
    "JSON(json)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "In the same way, we can also display the actual strip from the URL provided in JSON."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Displaying images"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We fetch the raw data from the image URL, from the JSON data, and render it using [IPython display Image helper class](https://ipython.readthedocs.io/en/stable/api/generated/IPython.display.html#IPython.display.Image)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<IPython.core.display.Image object>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 8,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "from IPython.display import Image\n",
    "\n",
    "url = json['img']\n",
    "response = requests.get(url)\n",
    "Image(response.content)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Fortunately, because this is popular use-case, it is enough to pass just the URL of the image to the Image helper class and it does also the fetch for us."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<IPython.core.display.Image object>"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 9,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "Image(url)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The XKCD strip from https://xkcd.com/ is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 2.5 License."
   ]
  }
 ],
